definition: A chronic condition characterized by persistently elevated arterial blood pressure.
description: Often asymptomatic. Long-term complications include cardiovascular, cerebrovascular, and renal disease.
whenToSeeDoctor: Persistent BP ≥140/90 mmHg or hypertensive symptoms.

definition: A metabolic disorder characterized by insulin resistance and relative insulin deficiency.
description: Common in adults; associated with obesity and sedentary lifestyle.
whenToSeeDoctor: Elevated fasting glucose or symptoms of hyperglycemia.

definition: A chronic inflammatory airway disease with variable airflow obstruction and bronchial hyperresponsiveness.
description: Symptoms include wheeze, dyspnea, chest tightness, and cough; often reversible.
whenToSeeDoctor: Frequent symptoms, nighttime awakenings, or rescue inhaler overuse.

definition: A primary headache disorder characterized by recurrent headaches, often unilateral and pulsating, with nausea and sensitivity to light/sound.
Infection of the lung parenchyma causing inflammation and consolidation.
Respiratory illness caused by SARS-CoV-2.
Inflammation of the stomach and intestines, typically causing diarrhea and vomiting.
Reduced hemoglobin concentration leading to decreased oxygen-carrying capacity of blood.
Inflammation of the appendix, often presenting with right lower quadrant abdominal pain.
Elevated body temperature above normal range (≈≥38.0°C).
A reflex to clear airways of mucus and irritants.
Discomfort in the chest that may be cardiac or non-cardiac in origin.
Pain originating from abdominal organs or wall.
Pain in the head region with diverse etiologies.
Subjective sensation of difficult or uncomfortable breathing.
A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) for pain and inflammation.
An analgesic and antipyretic agent.
A beta-lactam antibiotic used for common bacterial infections.
A biguanide that reduces hepatic glucose production and improves insulin sensitivity.
An ACE inhibitor used for hypertension and heart failure.
A short-acting beta-2 agonist bronchodilator.
Muscular organ that pumps blood through the circulatory system.
Paired respiratory organs for gas exchange.
Large glandular organ involved in metabolism, detoxification, and bile production.
Bean-shaped organ filtering blood and producing urine.
Central organ of the nervous system responsible for cognition and control.
Muscular organ where initial digestion of proteins occurs via gastric acid and enzymes.
A common blood test measuring hemoglobin, hematocrit, and cell counts.
Radiographic imaging of the chest to evaluate lungs, heart, and thoracic structures.
Recording of the heart’s electrical activity to assess rhythm and ischemia.
